Dear Ken: .
Our telephone conversation of today was most gratifying,
Naturally we" "aTe~TeTTprte^ toTnow of /our Hite rest in
WtT\JR aTT3 Tn Tts programming for the disadvantaged.
Our Public Relations Director is assembling a file of news¬
paper stories already printed about our endeavors. As soon
as it is complete we will send copies to you.
Meanwhile, you will find enclosed copies of the guidelines
for civil emergency conduct adopted by Milwaukee area broad¬
casters who have been meeting at this University,
It occurs to us that if your new publication is to be pro¬
duced by offset and you plan to use pictures, we might sup¬
ply a photograph of Miss Janis Gorham our student director
of Public Relations, She is a most attractive young woman
and happens also to be a Negro, Also, we would surely apprec
ate receiving copies of your publication.
Again, thanks for the pleasant call. We will be in touch
with the NAEB about all such programming on WUWM.
Ruane B. Hill
